data.title: Brazilian Moods • ArtsEarth
data.meta_description: "His voice is an extraordinarily communicative instrument, filled with darkly layered textures of sound." — Los Angeles Times | "Mr. Caymmi’s singing, simultaneously manly and fragile, expresses an appropriate humility and wonder." — The New York Times | Dori Caymmi - guitar, vocals; Scott Mayo - saxophone, vocals; Bill Cantos - piano, keyboards, vocals; Jerry Watts - bass; Mike Shapiro - drums, vocals
data.text:
Date/Time

7:30 PM - 9:30 PM

Miner Auditorium, SFJAZZ Center

Category(ies)

Add This Event to Your Calendar

iCal

Google Calendar

“His voice is an extraordinarily communicative instrument, filled with darkly layered textures of sound.” — Los Angeles Times “Mr. Caymmi’s singing, simultaneously manly and fragile, expresses an appropriate humility and wonder.” — The New York Times

Dori Caymmi – guitar, vocals

Scott Mayo – saxophone, vocals

Bill Cantos – piano, keyboards, vocals

Jerry Watts – bass

Mike Shapiro – drums, vocals

One of Brazil’s greatest songwriters and arrangers, Dori Caymmi sings in a warm baritone that floats and skips through the shapely melodies of his harmonically-rich music, a remarkable songbook which Sarah Vaughan, Gilberto Gil, Johnny Mathis and many others have mined. The son of legendary Brazilian musician Dorival Caymmi, his work is a gorgeous blend of pop, jazz and Brazilian sensibilities, and over his 50-year career he has released 11 solo recordings and written dozens of scores for theatre, film and television. In recent years, Caymmi has been recognized for his indelible contributions to Brazilan culture, receiving the Ordem do Rio Branco, the highest cultural honor bestowed by the Brazilian government. The two-time Grammy winner leads a crack quintet for his SFJAZZ Center debut.
